review_title: Working for Experience Mission was one of my best life decisions!
pros:
I've been working for Experience Mission full-time for 10 years and as an intern for two summers prior to that. It's been absolutely life changing! 

It's been wonderful to see how many lives have been impacted around the world through our programs, and I'm humbled to be able to get to do what I do. One of the best parts about working for Experience Mission is that I get to work with a wonderful team of staff and leaders who care deeply about me. My fellow team members at EM have helped me to discover my passions and achieve my potential in so many ways. At EM you're not just working for an organization, you are a part of a community of people who care about you and it's such a privilege to work together in this community toward a common mission and purpose.
cons: Given the breadth of the mission and work of EM it always feels like there's not enough time in the day to get everything done. This can be stressful but for me it's a sacrifice work making to know that my work is meaningful.

job_title: Program Director in Fort Wayne, IN
pros: Experience Mission has a tight knit staff who collaborate well and feel more like family than simply co-workers. Although there is a leadership structure, it is a relatively "flat" organization, which values the voice of everyone  from managers to interns to volunteers to community partners abroad. Experience Mission also provides a flexible work atmosphere with some employees working remotely a few days a week, but also coming together in a Washington & Indiana office. There is a high level of trust to work independently with flexible vacation policies, but also a culture of hard work and collaboration.
cons: Experience Mission is still a relatively new organization, so there are times when staffing and the speed of growth must find a balance. Employees can expect to wear a lot of hats and must adapt to new ideas and changes. This is an exciting environment for many, but may not be a good fit for all prospective applicants.

pros: I have worked as a full time employee with Experience Mission for over 10 years and prior to that was a summer intern for 2 summers. The values align with my personal values & the staff are not just co-workers, they are friends. Working with excellence but yet respecting & caring for one another is core to what we do. Whether you are a first time intern or have been on staff since day one, your voice will be heard & respected. I am grateful to work for sure a strong organization that values both the work we do and making sure we have a good work/life balance.

review_title: Best Work Experience of My Life
pros: EM has an incredible work culture with a family feel that translates into meaningful work in communities and on programs that span the U.S. and around the world. All voices are heard and every person is valued, from the newest intern to the most senior leadership.
cons: EM is a non-profit with limited resources to expand staff at a rapid pace, so when there's more work to be done it's "all hands on deck!" But this community of staff are more than willing to help each other and carry the load when the going gets tough and it's helped all of us grow together and believe in the work we're doing.

pros: The inner workings are just as genuine and hardworking as you'd hope. Everyone works hard, cares for one another, acts like adults, helps each other with the workload during busy seasons, and just likes each other. They are progressive in how they treat and care for employees and help them hone in their skills, as well as push them forward into the future. Their maternity/paternity leave policies are also progressive.
cons: It's hard to work remotely and not get as much face to face time, but that's situational for me as I'm not in either of the main offices.

pros: I have been working with Experience Mission in different capacities for almost 5 years. From a participant on IMMERSION, to an intern in the office and abroad, and now full time staff as of last year. This is an organization who truly values people. It's a great atmosphere where everyone has a voice, and you're more than just an employee, you're part of the EM family!
cons: With our team working between two offices as well as others who work remote we don't get a lot of face to face time all together, but we're super intentional to connect and work with each other. That helps bridge the gap!
